commit.message:
Close the multiprocessing.pool after use (#67)

So that the tests do not hang intermittently

When preparing to release Alpine Linux 3.12, the tests for this package
would hang intermittently. This problem was isolated to the tests in
test.bash that run rstcheck.py over multiple files.

The documentation for multiprocessing.pool explains that:

> Warning multiprocessing.pool objects have internal resources that need
> to be properly managed (like any other resource) by using the pool as
> a context manager or by calling close() and terminate() manually.
> Failure to do this can lead to the process hanging on finalization.

> Note that is not correct to rely on the garbage colletor to destroy
> the pool as CPython does not assure that the finalizer of the pool
> will be called (see object.__del__() for more information).

https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html#module-multiprocessing.pool

Before this commit close() was not called on the multiprocessing pool;
after this commit close() is called.

The change in this commit was tested in an Alpine Linux container:

    podman run -ti --rm -v $PWD:/srv:Z -w /srv alpine:edge sh

By running:

    apk add alpine-sdk python3 py3-docutils py3-setuptools bash
    python3 setup.py build
    sed -i '1s|^#!/usr/bin/env python$|#!/usr/bin/python3|' rstcheck.py
    python3 ./test_rstcheck.py
    bash ./test.bash

So that the tests do not hang intermittently

When preparing to release Alpine Linux 3.12, the tests for this package
would hang intermittently. This problem was isolated to the tests in
test.bash that run rstcheck.py over multiple files.

The documentation for multiprocessing.pool explains that:

> Warning multiprocessing.pool objects have internal resources that need
> to be properly managed (like any other resource) by using the pool as
> a context manager or by calling close() and terminate() manually.
> Failure to do this can lead to the process hanging on finalization.

> Note that is not correct to rely on the garbage colletor to destroy
> the pool as CPython does not assure that the finalizer of the pool
> will be called (see object.__del__() for more information).

https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html#module-multiprocessing.pool

Before this commit close() was not called on the multiprocessing pool;
after this commit close() is called.

The change in this commit was tested in an Alpine Linux container:

    podman run -ti --rm -v $PWD:/srv:Z -w /srv alpine:edge sh

By running:

    apk add alpine-sdk python3 py3-docutils py3-setuptools bash
    python3 setup.py build
    sed -i '1s|^#!/usr/bin/env python$|#!/usr/bin/python3|' rstcheck.py
    python3 ./test_rstcheck.py
    bash ./test.bash

commit.message: Replace nightly in Travis CI with 3.7
Remove obsolete version from Travis CI

Add --config option (#57)

* Add --config option

This addresses https://github.com/myint/rstcheck/issues/56

* Add docs and tests for --config option

Publish tests (cont.) (#55)

Include also `test.bash` which requires `examples/`.

Resolves #53

Publish test (#52)

To be able to run the test prior to installation, as part of building a distro package.
Increment minor version

Fix compatibility with sphinx>=1.8 (#51)

* Fix incompatibility with sphinx 1.8

* Test with several sphinx versions
Increment minor version to 3.3
Set development version and document history

Ignore specific errors (#48)

* Add new option to ignore messages

* Pass ignore as dict

* Add tests

* Fix parse args

* Check for ignore_messages

* Typo

* Update README

Avoid mutating ``args``

This closes #46 and closes #47.

Configuration file - part 2 (#44)

* Add bad examples to configuration file

* Update configuration file

* Add test for configuration file

* Update readme with full support for configuration file

* Update good.rst for configuration file

* Rename report_level to report
Add ALE as vim usage option (#45)
Expand comment
Make `check` rule more portable
Add @stsewd
Parse options from configuration file (#43)
Increment minor version to 3.2

Add `--recursive` option (#41)

This closes #40.

commit.message: Add @73VW

Allow configuration to be in setup.cfg (#38)

Added possibility to write configuration to a setup.cfg file
Added a variable containing the config files possibilities (still possible to add more)
Closes #37
Add valid example of Markdown-style link

Parse non-annotated text in Markdown search

The `str(node)` works, but has extra annotations:

    <paragraph>[Markdown-style Link](<reference refuri="https://www.example.com/">https://www.example.com/</reference>)</paragraph>

The latter is just the raw text from the paragraph:

    [Markdown-style Link](https://www.example.com/)
Add @biscuitsnake
Reject markdown-style links in RST (#35)

Document tests (#36)

* Document tests

* Reduce test matrix

* Try to work around PyPI timeouts
